text: Salah Stétié () (28 September 1929 – 19 May 2020) was a Lebanese writer, diplomat, translator and poet. He wrote in the French language. He also worked in many diplomatic positions for Lebanon in countries such as Morocco and France. Stetie chose to write in French because he believed that the Arabic language was outdated. He was born in Beirut. Stétié died in Paris on 19 May 2020 at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Lebanese politicians Category:Ambassadors of Lebanon Category:Lebanese poets Category:Translators Category:Historians Category:People from Beirut
title: Salah Stétié
